body:
@jackylk 
Please modify the readCSVFile method in GraphExecutionUtil.java to support  gzip file.
LGTM. Please handle the comment by @sujith71955 , I will  merge it.
@foryou2030 Please correct me if I am wrong, we can have multiple executor  how you are logging all the executor details, how you are printing details of each executor statistics details
@gvramana @ravipesala do we need this table, or direct logging the details is ok?
previously we were printing total number of blocks processed by each task and number of output records, please add the same in the executor statistics details
@foryou2030 QueryStatisticsRecorder is singleton then it is ok, queryId will be part of statistics object

If the column datatype is double and it data is like this:
-7489.7976
-11234567490
-11234567490
-1.2
-2
-11234567490
-11234567490
-11234567490
-11234567490
the query result would be all 0 using your pr, please verify this scenario.
@foryou2030 As QueryStatisticsRecorder is a singleton class after query execution we need to remove all the statistics details for the query, please handle this
I don't think it is a proper way to show tabular format in logs. Usually it is better to have either UI or any other separate tool to show the statistics.
@ravipesala Please check I have fixed all the review comments. http://136.243.101.176:8080/job/ApacheCarbonManualPRBuilder/49/

LGTM，and i l have fixed
 and will raise another pr for the issue i mentioned above.
@Vimal-Das review comment is handled. please check.

@ajayyadava Thanks for working on this. 
Can you add the steps that how the committer should use this tool?

@Vimal-Das Fixed review comments, and re-build CI has passed, please check:
http://136.243.101.176:8080/job/ApacheCarbonManualPRBuilder/62/

Also have to check if any impact on reading performance. 
Also what happens to behavior if this option is not set on university parser, Will it allow any number of columns?

LGTM...I think we can keep Carbon behavior different from hive as Carbon supports multiline....
@gvramana ...please comment...

what is the purpose of this Pr as one more PR is already raised https://github.com/apache/incubator-carbondata/pull/91 for statistics. You can merger both the prs

Please check the older code and add the statistics details: Please refer https://github.com/HuaweiBigData/carbondata/pull/852 for detail query statistics
+1 for a README to show how to use the tool.

LGTM
@kumarvishal09  +10 is just a buffer when we are auto calculating number of columns, not based on used input.

It seems many issues in spark-csv and we end up with copying most of there code to carbon and modify it. Instead we should directly use input format with univocity parser and use it for both generating dictionary and for loading data. 
Any way we can do this change while updating(removing kettle) the design of data loading.

+1
We go ahead with the current changes and take up Ravindra's suggestion in the req to remove kettle

@kumarvishal09, after discussed with jarry and u, 
I adjust the table struct, and fixed most of the comments, the new query statics shown like the follwing:
1. use singleton QueryStatisticsRecorder record driver statistics, check print in driver log
2. use the origin QueryStatisticsRecorder  record the executor statistics for each taskid, check print in executor log.

```
STATISTIC 01-09 11:50:32,311 - Time taken to load the Block(s) In Driver Side for the taskid :  Is : 117
STATISTIC 01-09 11:50:32,358 - Time taken to load the Block(s) In Driver Side for the taskid :  Is : 3
STATISTIC 01-09 11:50:32,401 - Print query statistic for query id: 832663758913772
+--------+--------------------+---------------------+----------------------+
|  Module|      Operation Step|                                  Query Cost|
+--------+--------------------+---------------------+----------------------+
|        |           SQL parse|                     |                 1.122|
|        +--------------------+                     +----------------------+
|  Driver|      Load meta data|                 1.21|                 0.052|
|        +--------------------+                     +----------------------+
|    Part|    Block allocation|                     |                 0.033|
|        +--------------------+                     +----------------------+
|        |Block identification|                     |                 0.003|
+--------+--------------------+---------------------+----------------------+

STATISTIC 01-09 11:50:33,111 - Print query statistic for each task id:
+-----------------+----------------+--------------------+----------------+---------------+-----------+-------------------+
|          task_id|load_blocks_time|load_dictionary_time|scan_blocks_time|scan_blocks_num|result_size|total_executor_time|
+-----------------+----------------+--------------------+----------------+---------------+-----------+-------------------+
|832663758913772_0|           0.047|               0.002|           0.019|              1|        950|              0.134|
+-----------------+----------------+--------------------+----------------+---------------+-----------+-------------------+

STATISTIC 01-09 11:50:34,739 - Total Time taken to prepare query result for the taskid : 832663758913772 Is : 1
STATISTIC 01-09 11:50:34,740 - Total Time taken to prepare query result for the taskid : 832663758913772 Is : 1
```
@mohammadshahidkhan can you add test case for this scenerio.

added test case PR build is also passed for the same
http://136.243.101.176:8080/job/ApacheCarbonManualPRBuilder/76/
@ajayyadava  can you provide the README to introduce how to use the tool, thanks.

@kumarvishal09 Can you run `PerfTest` in examples. It throws some exception as below.

```
java.lang.NullPointerException
    at org.apache.carbondata.scan.result.iterator.AbstractDetailQueryResultIterator.intialiseInfos(AbstractDetailQueryResultIterator.java:95)
    at org.apache.carbondata.scan.result.iterator.AbstractDetailQueryResultIterator.<init>(AbstractDetailQueryResultIterator.java:87)
    at org.apache.carbondata.scan.result.iterator.DetailQueryResultIterator.<init>(DetailQueryResultIterator.java:47)
```

Hello everyone,  
Sorry for delayed response,  the command to execute the script is at the top in comments. Just execute it like normal python script and it will help you set the environment and ask for input at each step. 

Having said that, I agree a Readme will be useful and will be happy to add it for carbondata as well. We(Apache Falcon) have documented it in confluence. Should I add it in confluence or code?
@ravipesala I tested with list implementation, there also its failing. I think its a different issue can you please check in your environment with older code and let me know its failing or not.

@chenliang613 

> What does this PR do?

The PR title should give some context and detailed context should be in the JIRA id mentioned in the PR title, right? Also, if users have made sensible and detailed commits, you will get extra information about what the patch does. Makes sense?

> Where should the reviewer start?

I am not sure if I fully understood you, can you please explain what should this contain?
closing this issue as another pr#120 is raised

LGTM 
@zuowang Thanks for working on it.

@ajayyadava ok, for the PR content, suggest adding these sections for easier reviewing:

Why raise this pr?
How to solve(implementation solution)?
How to test?
For example : https://github.com/apache/incubator-carbondata/pull/110

What is your opinion?
@QiangCai Can you add a test for this?

@chenliang613 

I really like the idea of adding a section on tests added / testing done. 
Why raise this PR? Won't this already be in the JIRA referenced in the PR? 
How to solve? I personally prefer design docs in JIRA but I believe it is a matter of taste and if community feels it is nice to add then we should definitely add it.

I have some time so I will go ahead and address some of the feedback, while we continue to discuss remaining issues.

@lion-x 
I think it is unnecessary to modify the following files.
CSVFilePartitioner.java
CSVParser.java
CSVReader.java
@chenliang613  I have added the README in the code. Let me know what do you think.

I think It is not easy to simulate the error.
You can check line 151, throw exception to stop compaction.

please modify test case MultiFilesDataLoadingTestCase.
I think the result should be 10 rows now.
OK, I have already renew some files by your suggestion.
